gw.api.geocode

Class GeocodeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.geocode.GeocodeUtils

  • public class GeocodeUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    GeocodeUtils provides a set of general-use methods for working with Geocoding functionality in both scripts and the UI.

    • Method Detail

      • currentPluginSupportsCorrections

        public static boolean currentPluginSupportsCorrections()
        Returns:
        true, if the current plugin supports returning at least a single correction for a provided address (although it may not always any)

      • currentPluginSupportsMultipleCorrections

        public static boolean currentPluginSupportsMultipleCorrections()
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin supports multiple corrections (may return multiple corrected addresses when geocodeAddressWithCorrections)

      • currentPluginSupportsDrivingDirections

        public static boolean currentPluginSupportsDrivingDirections()
        Returns:
        true, if the current plugin supports getting driving directions

      • currentPluginSupportsMappingByAddress

        public static boolean currentPluginSupportsMappingByAddress()
        Returns:
        true, if the current plugin supports getting a map for a given address

      • currentPluginSupportsFindByGeocode

        public static boolean currentPluginSupportsFindByGeocode()
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin supports generating a best-match address from a given Latitude/Longitude pair

      • currentPluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple

        public static boolean currentPluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple()
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin supports generating a list of potential-match addresses from a given Latitude/Longitude pair

      • currentPluginReturnsOverviewMapWithDrivingDirections

        public static boolean currentPluginReturnsOverviewMapWithDrivingDirections()
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin returns an overview map with the driving directions

      • currentPluginReturnsStepByStepMapsWithDrivingDirections

        public static boolean currentPluginReturnsStepByStepMapsWithDrivingDirections()
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin returns a set of step-by-step maps with the driving directions

      • isSuccessStatus

        public static boolean isSuccessStatus(GeocodeStatus status)
        Parameters:
        status - a given GeocodeStatus type key
        Returns:
        true, if the status given represents an address which has been successfully Geocoded.

      • isFailureStatus

        public static boolean isFailureStatus(GeocodeStatus status)
        Parameters:
        status - a given GeocodeStatus type key
        Returns:
        true, if the status given represents a Failed attempt to Geocode an address.

      • isNeverGeocodedStatus

        public static boolean isNeverGeocodedStatus(GeocodeStatus initialGeocodeStatus)
        Parameters:
        initialGeocodeStatus - a given GeocodeStatus type key
        Returns:
        true, if the status given represents a new address which is neither Geocoded nor for which a failed attempt to Geocode has been made.

      • isPluginEnabled

        public static boolean isPluginEnabled()
        Returns:
        true, there is a Geocoding plugin enabled.

      • getCurrentGeocodePlugin

        public static GeocodePlugin getCurrentGeocodePlugin()
        Returns the currently enabled Geocoding Plugin.
        Returns:
        the currently configured Geocode plugin, or null if no plugin is configured

      • getDefaultUnitOfDistance

        public static UnitOfDistance getDefaultUnitOfDistance()
        Returns the system-default unit of distance, as defined in config.xml

        Note that right now we do not support feet or meters as the default, as these should not be exposed by the UI unless the customer has a very specific reason for doing so.

        Returns:
        a UnitOfDistance type key, either TC_MILE or TC_KILOMETER

      • useMetricDistance

        public static boolean useMetricDistance()
        Returns:
        true, if the system is using Metric distances by default (as defined in config.xml)

      • getAddressByGeocode

        public static java.util.List<Address> getAddressByGeocode(java.math.BigDecimal latitude,
                                          java.math.BigDecimal longitude)
                                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Retrieves from the current Geocoding Plugin the list of possible addresses located at the Geocode (latitude/longitude pair) provided.

        If finding by geocode is not supported, this will return null.

        Parameters:
        latitude - the Latitude of the place to search for
        longitude - the Longitude of the place to search for
        Returns:
        A list of addresses, with geocode fields filled out, or null if no matches found. The first result returned should be the best match available, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.) If the geocoding service does not support multiple matches (pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple() returns true), this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch (AbstractGeocodePlugin implements this behavior.) If finding by geocode is not supported, this must return null.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

      • getAddressByGeocode

        public static java.util.List<Address> getAddressByGeocode(java.math.BigDecimal latitude,
                                          java.math.BigDecimal longitude,
                                          int maxResults)
                                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Retrieves from the current Geocoding Plugin the list of possible addresses located at the Geocode (latitude/longitude pair) provided. This caps the number of results found.

        If finding by geocode is not supported, this returns null.

        Parameters:
        latitude - the Latitude of the place to search for
        longitude - the Longitude of the place to search for
        maxResults - the maximum number of results to return, if a positive/non-zero integer. Returns all results if zero or negative.
        Returns:
        A list of addresses, with geocode fields filled out, or null if no matches found. The first result returned should be the best match available, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.) If the geocoding service does not support multiple matches (pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple() returns true), this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

      • getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch

        public static Address getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch(java.math.BigDecimal latitude,
                                   java.math.BigDecimal longitude)
                                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Retrieves from the current Geocoding Plugin that address which is the best match for the Geocode (latitude/longitude pair) provided.

        If finding by geocode is not supported, this must null.

        Parameters:
        latitude - the Latitude of the place to search for
        longitude - the Longitude of the place to search for
        Returns:
        An address providing the best match available for the provided Latitude and Longitude, or null if either no match was found, or this is not supported, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.).
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

      • distanceToString

        public static java.lang.String distanceToString(java.math.BigDecimal distance,
                                UnitOfDistance unit)
        Returns the given distance as a localized string, in either miles or kilometers, accurate to 1/10th of a mile or kilometer.
        Parameters:
        distance - a distance, in UNITS
        unit - a unit of distance, if null, the system default unit of distance is used.
        Returns:
        the distance, as a localized string either "___ miles" or "___ kilometers" depending on the unit of distance

      • getStateByNameOrCode

        public static State getStateByNameOrCode(java.lang.String stateName)
        Provides a single method to find a state by either name or typecode/abbreviation.
        Parameters:
        stateName - a string indicating a state, either by abbreviation (typecode) or name.
        Returns:
        the state's typekey

      • getCountryByNameOrCode

        public static Country getCountryByNameOrCode(java.lang.String countryName)
        Provides a single method to try find a Country by name or typecode (OOTB corresponds ISO 2-letter abbreviation. Has some limited "intelligence" for matching common short forms of country names.
        Parameters:
        countryName - a string indicating a state, either by abbreviation (typecode) or name.
        Returns:
        the state's typekey

      • addCountryNameOverride

        public static void addCountryNameOverride(Country c,
                          java.lang.String nameOverride)
        Overrides an entry in the name-to-country mapping, for example if you are receiving a non-standard name back from a Geocoding provider.
        Parameters:
        c - Country typekey to add
        nameOverride - the name to save into the mapping cache

      • getUnitsString

        public static java.lang.String getUnitsString(UnitOfDistance unit)
        Returns the localized word for a unit of distance, in plural (the typekey name is singular.)
        Parameters:
        unit - A UnitOfDistance typekey
        Returns:
        the localized string in plural as appropriate for UI dropdowns, etc.
